headline: GOP: A DOJ Department Prosecution Against Trump WILL Turn Into A Political War

In light of Republican lawmakers’ warnings that any Justice Department prosecution of former President Trump will turn into a political battle, Attorney General Merrick Garland faces a high bar in deciding whether to act on a criminal referral expected on January 6 from the House’s committee of jurisdiction.

An probe into President Trump must clear a “high threshold,” Sen. Thom Tillis (R-N.C.) said, raising worries about the “partisan wrangling” that surrounds the Jan. 6 committee’s creation.

After the House select committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack released a court filing last week, experts say evidence gathered by House investigators would be a strong push for prosecutors to take action against those responsible for that attack.

Lawyers for the Jan. 6 panel filed in a federal court in California to seek conservative lawyer and Trump adviser John Eastman’s emails, which is widely considered as a preliminary to a criminal referral later this year to the Justice Department.

Hillary Clinton should be prosecuted for what she did after 2016, says Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wisconsin), who would be in charge of the Permanent Investigations subcommittee if control of the Senate Homeland Security Committee changes hands.

On Thursday, Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.), a close Trump friend and senior member of the Senate Judiciary Committee, told The Hill that any recommendation to prosecute from the House select committee would have no credibility.

There are concerns that any federal charges against Trump will be seen by Republicans as politically motivated, which may lead to a political backlash that could hurt Biden’s efforts to unite the country in his 2020 campaign.

After his victory in the 2020 election, Biden privately told advisers that he didn’t want his president distracted by probes into Trump, NBC News reported at the time, citing five people familiar with the discussions.

Although the Senate Democrats voted to convict Trump of encouraging the January 6 uprising, they have been careful not to look that Garland is being pressured by political considerations to pursue charges.
